oai_dc:dc.dc:title: SEDIMENT TRANSPORT PROCESSES AT OCEAN BEACH, SAN FRANCISCO, CALIFORNIA
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Battalio, Robert T.
Trivedi, Dilip
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: sediment transport
Ocean Beach
San Francisco
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The San Francisco estuary inlet and tidal bar is a highly complex system that strongly influences littoral processes on adjacent beaches. Ocean Beach is about 4 miles long, located near the entrance to the estuary (Figures 1 and 2). The purpose of the study was to investigate the extent and causes of shoreline variability at Ocean Beach, and identify possible sand transport processes and directions based on available information (Moffatt & Nichol Engineers, 1994; 1995).
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 25 (1996): Proceedings of 25th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Orlando, Florida, 1996.
